intro: Hieracium petrophilum, commonly known as the rock groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained, alkaline soils. It produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium petrophilum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
